p: As shown in Figure 1d, food intake in diabetic rats was significantly increased compared to the control rats ( p < .001). During the study, control rats gained weight; in contrast, diabetic rats lost as expected ( p < .001) (Figure 1e). Treatment with TA, fennel (in both doses), and metformin significantly prevented weight loss during the study (all, p < .001) and reduced food intake compared to the STZ group ( p < .05 ‐ p < .001); however, none of them reached to the control level. No significant differences were also observed between the treatment groups (Figure 1d,e).
